metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7144 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenStack keystonemiddleware (formerly python-keystoneclient) 0.x before 0.11.0 and 1.x before 1.2.0 disables certification verification when the "insecure" option is set in a paste configuration (paste.ini) file regardless of the value, which allows remote attackers to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks via a crafted certificate.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-keystoneclient - 1:0.7.1-ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> will not be fixed before 14.10 goes EoL upstream patch requires a more recent version of oslo.config than what is currently in trusty

criterions.comment: python-keystoneclient package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:0.7.1-ubuntu1.2').
